newsitem.title: USA: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to Watch - Sept 19.
newsitem.headline: U.S. HEADLINE STOCKS - Issues to Watch - Sept 19.

text.p: -- Eastman Chemical said it expects third quarter earnings to fall short of analysts' estimates.
Eastman Chemical closed up 3/8 at 56-3/8 on Wednesday.
-- Ford Motor Co expects up to 1,000 job cuts at its Halewood plant in northwest England, the Guardian newspaper said. Ford closed off 1/4 to 32-1/8.

-- Kansas City Power and Light Co abandonded its eight-month effort to merge with UtiliCorp United Inc, citing a lack of shareholder support in the face of a more lucrative merger bid from Western Resources Inc.
KCP&L closed at 27-1/4. UtiliCorp closed at 27-7/8.
-- Bally Entertainment Corp's chairman will be named president of Hilton Hotels Corp's gambling business after the Bally-Hilton merger, the Wall Street Journal said.
Bally closed at 26-3/4. Hilton closed at 105-5/8.

-- Hughes Electronics Corp will announce plans to combine its satellite system with PanAmSat Corp's satellite network to become a global distributor of video, voice and data services, the Wall Street Journal said.
Hughes closed at 37-3/4. PanAmsat closed at 26-3/4.
-- Valhi Inc said it agreed to sell its building products business for $230 million and the assumption of debt.
